intro: Limonium paramedium, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, spike-like flower heads. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Limonium paramedium thrives in coastal areas and well-drained soils, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens and landscapes around the world.
